title: General News
custom_preconds:
URL for main news index - http://content.mlb.com/app/mlb/gen/content/tag/v1/mlb/news/newsreader.json
URL for team specific news index - http://content.mlb.com/app/mlb/gen/content/tag/v1/bal/news/newsreader.json
Spanish - http://content.mlb.com/app/mlb/gen/content/tag/v1/mlb/news/es/newsreader.json

Spinner Menu - Drop down menu with list of all MLB teams and Postseason News during postseason.

custom_steps_separated.content: User navigates to News section of app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User should be taken to MLB.com News index

User should see drop down spinner where they can select individual team indexes.
User should see list of articles with:

Thumbnail image
Article headline
Article time and date in format: <HH:MM> <AM/PM>, <Day>, <Mon> <DD>

custom_steps_separated.content: If a thumbnail image is not available for a given article
custom_steps_separated.expected: There should be a MLB placeholder thumbnail

custom_steps_separated.content: When user swipes through article index
custom_steps_separated.expected: Placeholder thumbnails should appear as article thumbnail images are being loaded

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the drop down spinner 
And the user selects a team from the list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the spinner should show the selected team
And the news index for that team should load.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has one or more favorite teams set in the app
And the user taps the drop down spinner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then their favorite team(s) will be listed under a "Favorite Teams" category
and this will be located under the "MLB" filter
and above the "Teams" category

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user changes the orientation of the device on the News index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the orientation of the app should change from portrait to landscape or vice versa
And the user's scroll position in the article index should be maintained.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an article in the news index
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the News Article Page for the article they selected.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to an article page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio and Video icons should not appear in the action bar
And they should be replaced by "Text Resize" and "Share" buttons

And the hamburger menu should not appear
And the 'Up' button should appear

And the number of the article within the index along with the total number of articles in the index should appear in the action bar. (ie. 4 of 30)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Text Resize button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the text should get larger with each tap up to two times. 
And tapping the button when the text is at its largest size should update the text to the smallest size.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Share icon in the action bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Android Share Menu will appear with the list of applications the user can share to.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the article has a video associated with it
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then at the top of the article the video should appear
And there should be an image
And there should be a play button.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the video in an article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video should play
And when the video is done, the user should be returned to the article from which they launched the video

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user changes orientation of the device on an article page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the orientation should change from portrait to landscape and vice versa
And the layout of the article should still be readable.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes left or right on an article page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the article will transition to the next or previous article in the index
And the number on the action bar should update to reflect the number of the article in the index along with the total number of articles in the index
And the user should NOT be able to loop through the index. (Cannot swipe from article 1 to article 30)
And if the user changes the device orientation after swiping from one article to another they should remain on the same article 

**Test on general MLB news index article and on article from team index**

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is an article that does NOT have an associated video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not see a blank video image
They should see the associated image

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is an article that does NOT have an associated image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the article should load
And the article should not contain a blank space where the video should be. (There should be a placeholder image)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the article has player card tokens in the data
And the user taps on a player card link in the article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the player card should open in an internal webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the article has a link to external content in the data
And the user taps on the link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the link should open

title: News Article Sharing
custom_preconds:
User has the Twitter for Android App installed (And valid Twitter testing account)
User has the Facebook for Android App installed (And valid Facebook testing account)
User has a Mail or Gmail account logged in
custom_steps: When the user taps the Share Button on the Article page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Twitter app in the Share menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Compose Tweet screen should appear with the Article's URL pre-populated

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Twitter app in the Share menu
And the user composes and posts the tweet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Compose Tweet screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the article page they were previously on
And the Tweet should be sent successfully (check on twitter and verify that the link in the tweet takes the user to the correct article.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user begins to share with Twitter and has launched the Compose Tweet screen
And the user navigates backwards (using the Android back button or tapping back navigation in the top left corner)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Compose Tweet screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the article page belonging to the article they tried to share.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Facebook app in the Share menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Facebook Post screen should appear with the Article's URL and Metadata pre-populated. (Note: Metadata may not appear with an article shared from QA.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Facebook app in the Share menu
And the user composes and posts the article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Facebook Post screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the article page belonging to the article they tried to share. 

And the Post should be sent successfully (check on Facebook and verify that the link in the post takes the user to the correct article.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user begins to share with Facebook and has launched the Facebook post screen
And the user navigates backwards (using the Android back button or tapping back navigation in the top left corner)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Facebook Post screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the article page belonging to the article they tried to share.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Email app or Gmail in the Share menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the subject of the email should be pre-populated with the Article Title
And the URL of the article should be pre-populated in the message body

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the shares the article through Email
And sends the email
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Email app should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the article page belonging to the article they tried to share. 

And the Email should be sent successfully (check on the recipient's end and verify that the link in the email takes the user to the correct article.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has already tapped to share at least one article on a given device
And the user returns to a news article page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the app the user selected to share the article should appear as a quick option next to the share button
And if the user taps on the application's icon in the action bar they should be directed to the share window for that application

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the News Index in Portrait
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the top main article/story with a grey box under the text

custom_steps_separated.content:
when a user is viewing the News Index in Portrait 
as a LITE user
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a main story followed by two smaller stories 
followed by the native ad followed by two smaller stories and then a main story
and this pattern will continue as the user scrolls down the index
and each article will be separated by rules that never disappear

custom_steps_separated.content:
when a user is viewing the News Index in Portrait 
as a PAID user
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a main story followed by three smaller stories
and this pattern will continue as the user scrolls down the index
and each article will be separated by rules that never disappear

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the News Index in Landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the main story will be followed by two rows of two smaller stories in each row
and this pattern will continue as the user scrolls down the index

title: Native Ads
custom_steps:
When a LITE user navs to any At Bat News Index
and the device is in Portrait
custom_expected:
Then as the user scrolls down the index, they will see a native Ad after the first three articles
and then after every fifth article in the Index
